text: I am boiling up some potatoes guys
because it's picnic season and it's time
to make some potato salad so I've boiled
three pounds of red potatoes after all
the steam dissipates you'd be able to
see them well I'm a sec here they are
took about fifteen or twenty minutes and
I cooked them whole and I'm gonna cut
them up when they cool just a little bit
while they cool off just a little bit I
will get my dressing ready so this is
sort of like an a Mexican inspired
recipe but it's really really simple 1/2
a cup of mayonnaise this dish was kind
of inspired by this corn snack that you
get on the street either in Mexico or in
my neighborhood in Queens where there's
a lot of Mexican immigrants living and
they take corn and they put mayonnaise
on it and they sprinkle it with cheese
and chili and lime and its really good
too that you add a cup of cooked corn
I prefer fresh you can just cut the
kernels right off the cob and cook it
for a couple of seconds I suppose if you
had to you could use frozen for a little
bit of spice a tablespoon of chopped
chipotle chili that adds spiciness but
it also adds smokiness and those come in
a can and you should be able to find
them in the ethnic aisle at your market
now let's see if you can't get Chipotle
what could you use a little bit of
cayenne it's not going to taste the same
but it'll give the heat without the
smokiness I guess you could put bacon in
here for smokiness if you can't find
Capote Lee's YUM all right that's your
base for Tang enos some lime juice this
cute little lime squeezer it's the
perfect lime size really only need about
a tablespoon and I got plenty of lime
juice out of that one half of the lime
so save the other half for your
cocktails tonight so this is ready I'm
gonna add potatoes to it to make it into
a potato salad so these are red skin
potatoes they've cooled off enough for
me to cut them and they need to be cut
into 1 and 1/2 inch pieces I like to add
the potatoes to the dressing when
they're just a little bit warm because
then they absorb the flavors even better
than if they're cold so let them cool
off just a little
now you just combine everything together
that's it if you want to add more
vegetables to this you certainly could I
like to add even more corn sometimes
just give it like tons and tons of corn
summertime I can't get enough corn so go
crazy you want to put some cilantro in
here mmm
Chile's more Chile's fresh chiles feel
like it's super spicy it's really
delicious just the way that it is though
so you don't feel the need to embellish
it anyway I'm just always thinking like
what's the next great thing I can do
season with salt and pepper but always
really do add a nice smokiness let's see
if it needs anything mmm
the corn is nice and crunchy there's
smoky spiciness from the Chipotle's it's
really really fantastic and delicious I
recommend that you make this and bring
